profileAlternative.name: Dekun Pei
profileAlternative.headline: Experienced in application development using C++, MATLAB, and Java.
profileAlternative.summary:
I used C++, MATLAB, and Java to develop features for Simulink and Stateflow, with a focus on simulation through code generation technologies and external code integration into Simulink environment.

I have a strong desire to learn new skills and adapt to new responsibilities. Prior to becoming a software engineer at the MathWorks, I completed a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineer and leveraged my knowledge in MATLAB and Smulink to provide application support to MathWorks’s users for a year and a half.

aboutAlternative.text:
I used C++, MATLAB, and Java to develop features for Simulink and Stateflow, with a focus on simulation through code generation technologies and external code integration into Simulink environment.

I have a strong desire to learn new skills and adapt to new responsibilities. Prior to becoming a software engineer at the MathWorks, I completed a Master of Science in Mechanical Engineer and leveraged my knowledge in MATLAB and Smulink to provide application support to MathWorks’s users for a year and a half.

positions.title: The MathWorks
positions.description:
• Revamped external C/C++ code integration for Stateflow code-generation-based simulation by introducing external C/C++ symbols type information into the code generation intermediate representation
• Develop simulation infrastructure used chiefly by Stateflow, MATLAB Function blocks, and MATLAB System blocks
• Implemented conditional breakpoints for MATLAB Function block in a code base that uses Java, C/C++, and MATLAB
• Enhanced Simulink MATLAB Function block to simulate 25% faster than baseline by implementing an asynchronous termination request detection
…
see more

• Specialized in Deployment, Test and Measurement, and API areas
• Served as a Group Leader for technical support activities

positions.title: Georgia Institute of Technology
positions.description:
• Researched optimal control strategies for hybrid vehicles
• Modeled various hybrid vehicle architectures using MATLAB and Simulink
• Mentored undergraduate students on a hydraulic hybrid school bus project
• Developed, maintained and tested a hydraulic hybrid prototype school bus
• Received Final Four honors in the ACC Clean Energy Challenge for the hydraulic hybrid school bus business plan
• Completed graduate courses in control theory, dynamics and simulations

positions.title: Clerk and Assistant Manager

given.text:
I worked with Keong Yong to compete in the inaugural ACC Clean Energy Challenge in spring 2012. He was the strongest asset to the team and he has showcased his excellent project management skills and leadership during the project. Even though he had limited business knowledge in the beginning, Keong bravely volunteered to take lead to write the business proposal for the project. One could only imagine the countless hours he spent on improving his knowledge and polishing the business plan. Keong’s effort was indispensable in our success in the Clean Energy Challenge. Even well after the conclusion of the competition, Keong was did pro bono work to create a website for the project, further raising awareness of it. This once again shows his versatility and his commitment to whatever he works on. If I am given the chance again, I will definitely choose to work with Keong.
…
See more

items: Forward-Looking Simulation of the GM Front-Wheel Drive Two-Mode Power-Split HEV Using a Dynamic Programming-Informed Equivalent Cost Minimization Strategy
Dynamic Programming-Informed Equivalent Cost Minimization Control Strategies for Hybrid-Electric Vehicles
